article-meta.issue-title: Fifty Years Beyond the Brink: Writing the Cuban Missile Crisis

body.p: The Cuban missile crisis has been a subject of considerable fascination for the twenty something years that I have been an academic. I am therefore deeply appreciative of the editors of International Relations for providing me with an opportunity to reflect, and encourage others to reflect, on the crisis fifty years on. I am particularly grateful to Ken Booth, who has long supported my study of nuclear and intelligence history, and whose help and guidance in preparing this special issue has been gratefully received. So too has the hard work and good judgement of my colleague Kris Stoddart in commenting upon and preparing for publication the articles in this collection. I am also grateful to the anonymous reviewers for their helpful and speedy comments.
